intro: Diphasiopsis whitei, commonly known as the White's diphasiopsis, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. It is native to the mountainous regions of South America, particularly in countries like Bolivia and Peru. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky soils, thriving in cool, temperate climates. Its leaves are finely divided and emit a strong, spicy scent when crushed, which is a common trait among members of its family. The flowers, which are small and white, bloom in summer and attract various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
